ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: that Day man will remember what he has striven for
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The day when man remembers all that he had done,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: on the Day when man will recall all his strivings,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the human being will recall whatever he has done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: On that day man will recall all what he strove for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The Day when man shall remember what he strove for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The day on which man shall recollect what he strove after,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: upon the day when man shall remember what he has striven,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The day when man will call to mind his (whole) endeavour,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: on the Day that man remembers what he strove for
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Day whereon man shall rember whatsoever he had striven for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: —the day when man will remember his endeavours
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Day when man shall remember (all) that he strove for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Day when man shall remember what he strove for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the Day when the human will remember what he has worked for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A Day when man will remember what he has endeavored.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:35] the day when man will remember (yawma yatadhakkaru’l-insānu substitutes for idhā, ‘when’) his efforts, in the [life of the] world, in the way of good or evil,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The day when man will call to mind) when the disbeliever, al-Nadr Ibn al-Harith and his host, will remember and know (his (whole) endeavour) the works he did in his state of disbelief,
